definition: to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
lamp/light/lantern/CL:盞|盏[zhan3]
night
to fight/fight/war/battle

sentences.english: He has the habit of burning the midnight oil before tests.
sentences.chinese: 考試前他有挑燈夜戰的習慣。

sentences.english: I have to burn the midnight oil to complete the report.
sentences.chinese: 我必須挑燈夜戰來完成此報告。

sentences.english: Many corners are still on, working or corrupting.
sentences.chinese: 很多角落依然在挑燈夜戰，或忙碌或墮落。

sentences.english: We have to go home and burn the midnight oil tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今晚我們必須回家挑燈夜戰。

sentences.english: I have to study every night.
sentences.chinese: 我每晚都得挑燈夜戰了。

sentences.english: I pulled an all-nighter to study for my English exam.
sentences.chinese: 我挑燈夜戰準備我的英文考試。

sentences.english: Each of them mounted fresh horses to start the night fight.
sentences.chinese: 二人各換一匹馬，開始了挑燈夜戰。

sentences.english: He used to burn the midnight oil before exam.
sentences.chinese: 他過去考試前總要挑燈夜戰。

sentences.english: More and more pupils are burning the midnight oil.
sentences.chinese: 愈來愈多的學生都在挑燈夜戰。

definition: Dacun township in Changhua county 彰化縣|彰化县[Zhang1 hua4 xian4], Taiwan
class timetable
on call/always available/ready at all times
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time
to drip with sweat/sweat poured off (him)
it's the most capable people who do the most work (idiom) (intended as consolation for the overworked, or flattery when making a request etc)
video program
red in the face/extremely angry
to race against time
all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
equestrianism/horsemanship
